answers.answer: Hello,There are some causes which need to be evaluated for the dribbling of urine. An obstruction, anatomical malformations, foreign bodies or lesions at the tip of the urethra may cause dribbling of the urine.  It can be due to prostrate, urethral stricture and narrowing of the urethral meatus. Regarding nocturia( urinating during night), it can be due to diabetes mellitus and diabetes inspidus, kidney stones, prostatitis, irritable bladder and hyperparathyroidism. I’ll suggest you to consult a nephrologist and try to find out the underlying cause of nocturia.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: I am having problems leaking from my penis (just dribble).  I believe it is urine.  There is no pain, puss or bad smell associated with various STDs I just feel like there is excess pee in my penis that won't stay in my bladder.A little medical history:-Age 26, frequent pot smoker, social drinker but not excessive, anxiety issues, frequent ejaculator (1 or 2x a day from sex and masterbation) Premature ejaculator, sometimes tough time maintaining an erection if I hold off, taking no medicationsI mentioned some of these because I read it could b related to an enlarged prostate, but aren't I a bit young?  On that note, I usually always have to wake up and pee in the night time.
title: Can't close the valve!
